Detailed Description

This is the actor class for Rigid Objects.

This class should be used to make any rigid object that can be moved as a result of force. Most objects will fall into this catagory. A few examples of a Rigid Object: Boxes, Car Frames, Chairs, etc. For Semi Rigid bodies that are deformable, like jello, it is better to use ActorSoft.

Definition at line 232 of file physactor.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ActorRigid::ActorRigid ( PhysReal  mass,
PhysString  name,
PhysString  file,
PhysString  group,
PhysWorld *  World 
)

Sets the location of the physics body.

This will take a PhysVector3 and set the location of the actor within the physics world.
This function is called on by the SetLocation function, and shouldn't be called manually. Descriptive constructor.

This constructor contains the basic information needed to make a Rigid Object.
This class inherits from ActorBase.

Parameters:
Mass The mass the object will have in the PhysWorld.
Name The name of the actor.
File The 3d mesh file that contains the 3d model the actor will use.
Group The resource group where the 3d mesh and other related files can be found.
World Pointer to the PhysWorld this object will be added to.

Adds the actor to the physics world.

Adds the actor to the physics world.
This is automaticly called by the PhysWorlds AddActor function and shouldn't be called manually.

Creates a rigid object for the actor.

Creates a rigid object to be placed in the physics world later.
This is automaticly called by the Constructor and shouldn't be called manually.

Definition at line 346 of file physactor.cpp.

void ActorRigid::CreateShapeFromMesh (  ) 

Creates a collision shape from mesh file.

This function will read the location of every verticy in the mesh file and use that to construct a triangle mesh shape and attach it to this objects collision shape.
